meanings.definition: To add moisture to the skin.
meanings.sent1: I always moisturise my face before bed.
meanings.sent2: Remember to moisturise your hands after washing them.
meanings.sent3: After a long day in the sun, my skin begs me to moisturise.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words seemed to moisturise his wounded spirit.
meanings.sent5: The rain came down to moisturise the thirsty earth.

meanings.sent1: She used aloe vera to moisturise the dry plant leaves.
meanings.sent2: Moisturise the soil regularly to keep your plants healthy.
meanings.sent3: The desert desperately needed a giant hand to moisturise it.
meanings.sent4: His laughter seemed to moisturise the tense atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The music seemed to moisturise the dry conversation, making it flow smoothly.
